themes: Need for funding and partnership with smaller organizations
Critique of lack of diversity in leadership
Overemphasis on mainstream or trendy entertainment
Importance of supporting minority and queer artists
Recognition of grassroots cultural spaces and organizers
key_phrases: partner and fund these smaller organizations that are doing the work already
it doesn't need to be a wheel that is reinvented
there needs to be diversity in the leadership that is sourcing these opportunities not just white people with money and access to spaces
Austin was built on this concept on being weird but a lot of what is funded and broadcasted for entertainment has been trendy
we need to involve the smaller creatives creating variety shows and creating spaces for new artists
These are just some of the organizers and organizations really providing spaces for minority artists, cultural heritage and accessible spaces to exist
mentioned_programs: Asian Family Support Services of Austin
barriers_identified: Lack of funding and partnership for smaller organizations
Leadership lacking diversity (dominated by white people with money and access to spaces)
Preference for trendy/mainstream entertainment over grassroots or minority-led initiatives
solutions_proposed: Partner and fund smaller organizations already doing the work
Increase diversity in leadership sourcing opportunities
Involve smaller creatives creating variety shows and spaces for new artists
